bibl.title: Surgeon General's Office Record Card, January 25, 1907

div1.p: The record card includes several requests for photographs or paintings of Reed, along with information regarding his uniform. The record card is dated from January 25, 1907 through August 15, 1907. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Surgeon General's Office Record Card, January 25, 1907

U-2. January 25, 1907.
The Review of Reviews Co.,
13 Astor Place, New York, N. Y.
Gentlemen: In reply to your
favor of the 24th instant the
Surgeon General has asked me
to enclose you a portrait
of the late Dr. Walter Reed,
also a copy of a message the
President sent to Congress,
dated December 5, 1906. It is
hoped this message will con-
tain valuable information
to assist you in preparing
your article in reference to
the transmission of yellow
fever by mosquitoes.

M. W. I., Maj., Surg., U. S. A.
J.

3 Jan. 29, 07
Anne Fletcher, Richmond,
Va., Jan 26, 07. Requests
that she be sent a de-
scription of the rank
and full dress uniform
of Dr. Walter Reed, es-
pecially exact color of
uniform, and descrip-
tion of epaulettes, for
use in painting his
portrait.

M S O. refers Jan. 29, 07.
1204909 M S O. ky

3 Jan. 30, 1907. Miss Anne Fletcher,
217 West Grace St., Richmond, Va. Madam
Replying to your letter of the 26th
instant, I am directed by the Surgeon
General to send you the enclosed
print of full dress uniform of staff
officer at the time of Major Walter
Reed's service, except that the in-
signia of the Med. Dept. does not ap-
pear thereon; a draft of the insignia
is enclosed and should be shown in
center of the shoulder knot.

P. F. S., Maj.,Surg., U. S. A.
B.M.I.

U3 Feb. 1, 07.
Robert Lanier, Review of
Reviews, N. Y., Jan. 29, 07.
acknowledges receipt of
